title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer will practice at both second and third base during Red Sox spring training.
Durbin was acquired from the Milwaukee Brewers and Mayer is a second-year infielder with a shortstop background.
Manager Alex Cora aims to finalize the infield lineup soon but remains undecided on the second and third base roles.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Ashton Grant will remain as the Patriots' quarterbacks coach and won't pursue OC roles with other teams.
Grant chose not to interview for open offensive coordinator jobs with the Raiders, Rams, and Seahawks.
Drake Maye praised Grant for his role in learning a new offense, noting his impact on Maye's growth.

title: Brighton community raises $25k for flooded barbershop
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Burst pipe floods Matt's Barber Shop in Brighton; GoFundMe launched to aid recovery efforts.
Community donations exceed $25,800 for Matt's Barber Shop after flood damage.
Benefit show scheduled on Feb. 19 at O’Brien’s Pub to support Matt's Barber Shop rebuild.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Eternity,' starring Elizabeth Olsen and Miles Teller, is now streaming on Apple TV.
'Harold & Maude,' featuring Bud Cort, is available on Pluto TV after Cort's recent passing.
'Love Is Blind' Season 10 is premiering on Netflix, coinciding with Valentine's Day.

title: Court says Mass. father’s battle over LGBTQ-friendly lessons excludes books on gender stereotypes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A federal judge ruled that two storybooks on gender stereotypes are not part of a lawsuit over LGBTQ lessons in Lexington.
Plaintiff Alan L. argued the books fall under the injunction due to 'gender identity' issues, but the judge disagreed.
The court found that the books did not infringe on Alan L.'s religious beliefs, allowing their use in the classroom.

title: Roman Anthony set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic if he passes physical
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony, 21, will join Team USA for the World Baseball Classic, pending a successfully completed physical.
Anthony is set to replace injured Diamondbacks outfielder Corbin Carroll, who suffered a hand fracture.
Anthony could enhance Team USA's outfield with strong performance against left-handed pitching, having hit .278 last season.

title: $20M penthouse at Taylor Swift’s rumored wedding venue hits market
author: Regina Cole
bullets: Ocean House penthouse at 1 Bluff Avenue #4-1 in Westerly, RI, listed for $20 million.
The 4,696 sq ft penthouse features 3 bedrooms, 4 bathrooms, and a 2,400 sq ft terrace.
Ownership includes access to Ocean House Club amenities, like a private beach, gym, and spa.

title: 10 Celtics stats that should show encouragement and discouragement entering All-Star break
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Boston Celtics rank second in the Eastern Conference with a 35-19 record entering the All-Star break.
Jaylen Brown scores 29.3 points per game, leading to his first All-Star starter selection.
Celtics struggle in clutch situations, posting a 12-14 record, the worst among current playoff teams.

title: Your Cape Cod winter guide: 20 things to do during the cold months
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Cape Cod offers diverse winter activities including museums, trails, and dining despite its reputation as a summer destination.
Major attractions include the Sandwich Glass Museum, Hyannis Kennedy Legacy Trail, and Wydah Pirate Museum.
Winter recreation options feature hiking, cross-country skiing, and visits to breweries and vineyards.

title: She’s running Boston for people like her with Type 1 Diabetes
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Kristine 'Krissy' Lapczynski, a 30-year-old pharmacist, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Breakthrough T1D.
Lapczynski, diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes at age 7, had a life-threatening experience with diabetic ketoacidosis in Boston.
She aims to inspire her daughter and support T1D research by running the marathon despite the challenges of diabetes.
